nodes.text: An e-nursery retail website that integrates clustering-based recommendation algorithms and visual data representation will enhance user experience and optimize business operations for plant nurseries and customers
Implementing clustering algorithms (e.g., K-means, hierarchical clustering) on collected customer and product data enables grouping of users with similar preferences and behaviors

Visual data representation (using Tableau and Matplotlib) provides interactive dashboards and charts that make sales trends, customer demographics, and product popularity more understandable to stakeholders
A web-based platform with standard e-commerce features (secure payment gateway, shopping cart, registration, login, product catalog and checkout) is necessary to deliver the e-nursery service
Integrating clustering-based recommendations and visual analytics yields practical benefits: personalized product suggestions, improved navigation, inventory insights, and better marketing decisions
Method: Gather dataset components including plant catalog attributes, customer registrations (demographics), purchase history, search activity, and product feedback for analysis
Result: Use data preparation and clustering to assign users to clusters and generate recommendations based on cluster membership and past behavior
Method: Integrate project database with Tableau for dashboards and use Matplotlib for additional visualizations to enable interactive filtering and drill-down exploration
Method: Implement secure payment integration (e.g., PayPal, Visa), diverse payment methods, real-time product availability, shopping cart features, and order receipt generation
Context: Prior studies report that K-means and related clustering approaches improve personalized recommendations and mobile e-commerce satisfaction
Context: Literature on hybrid and deep learning recommender approaches demonstrates alternative methods and challenges such as cold-start, data sparsity, and the potential for improved accuracy

Evidence/Result: Prototype website GUI modules were developed and demonstrated, including login, registration, home page, product pages, add-to-cart, checkout, payment receipt, and a personalized recommendation page
Evidence: Example personalized recommendation observed in the prototype where adding Piper Betel Maghal resulted in a recommendation of Aloe vera based on past choices
Limitation: The project and cited prior work acknowledge data limitations, algorithm parameter sensitivity, and cold-start/data sparsity challenges affecting recommendation accuracy
